gurmukhi: ਝਮੀ ਤੇਜ ਤੇਗੰ ਸੁ ਰੋਸੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰ ॥ ਰੁਲੇ ਰੁੰਡ ਮੁੰਡੰ ੳੁਠੀ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਝਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Jhamoondtej Tegadg Su Rosan Prahaaran|| Rule Round Mounndan Outhoo Sastra Jhaaran||
translation: The sharp swords glisten and are struck with great rage. Somewhere the trunks and heads are rolling in dust and with the collision of weapons, the fire-sparks arise.

gurmukhi: ਬਬਕੰਤ ਬੀਰੰ ਭਭਕੰਤ ਘਾਯੰ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਜੁੱਧ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰੰ ਜੁਟਿਓ ਬ੍ਰਿਤਰਾਯੰ ॥੪੩॥
transliteration: Babkant Booran Bhabhkant Ghaayan|| Mano Juddh Indran Joutio Britaraayan||43||
translation: Somewhere the warriors are shouting and somewhere the blood is emerging out of the wounds. It appears that Indira and Britrasura are engaged in war 43.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਜੁੱਧ ਮੱਚਿਯੰ ਮਹਾਂ ਸੂਰ ਗਾਜੇ ॥ ਅਪੋ ਅਾਪ ਮੈਂ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੋਂ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਬਾਜੇ ॥
transliteration: Mahaan Juddh Machchiyan Mahaan Soor Gadje|| Apo Aap Main Sastra Son Sastra Baaje||
translation: The terrible war is in progress in which the great heroes are thundering. The weapons collide with the confronting weapons.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੇ ਝਾਰ ਸਾਂਗੰ ਮਚੇ ਲੋਹ ਕ੍ਰੋਹੰ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਖੇਲ ਬਾਸੰਤ ਮਾਹੰਤ ਸੋਹੰ ॥੪੪॥
transliteration: Outhe Jhaar Saanadg Mache Loh Krohan|| Mano Khel Baasant Maahant Sohan||44||
translation: The sparks of fire came out of the striking spears and in violent rage, the steel reigns supreme; it seems that good persons, looking impressive, are playing Holi.44.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤੇ ਬੈਰ ਰੁੱਝੰ ॥ ਤਿਤੇ ਅੰਤ ਜੁੱਝੰ ॥
transliteration: Jite Bair Rujjhan|| Tite Ant Jujjhan||
translation: All the fighters engaged in war against their enemies, ultimately fell as martyrs.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤੇ ਖੇਤ ਭਾਜੇ ॥ ਤਿਤੇ ਅੰਤ ਲਾਜੇ ॥੪੫॥
transliteration: Jite Khet Bhaanje|| Tite Ant Laaje||45||
translation: All those who have run away from the battlefield, they all feel ashamed at the end. 45.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਟੇ ਦੇਹ ਬਰਮੰ ॥ ਛੁਟੀ ਹਾਥ ਚਰਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Toute Deh Baramannd|| Chhoutoo Haath Charamannd||
translation: The armours of the bodies are broken and the shields have fallen from the hands.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਖੇਤ ਖੋਲੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ਸੂਰ ਟੋਲੰ ॥੪੬॥
transliteration: Kahoon Khet Dholan|| Gire Soor Tolan||46||
translation: Somewhere there are helmets scattered in the battlefield and somewhere the groups of warriors have fallen.46.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਮੁੱਛ ਮੁੱਖੰ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੱਖੰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Mouchchh Moukkhan|| Kahoon Sastra Sakkhan||
translation: Somewhere the faces with whiskers have fallen, somewhere only weapons are lying.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਖੋਲ ਖੱਗੰ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਪਰਮ ਪੱਗੰ ॥੪੭॥
transliteration: Kahoon Dhol Khadganng|| Kahoon Param Paggadg||47||
translation: Somewhere there are scabbards and swords and somewhere there are only few lying in the field.47.

gurmukhi: ਗਹੇ ਮੁੱਛ ਬੰਕੀ ॥ ਮੰਡੇ ਅਾਨ ਹੰਕੀ ॥
transliteration: Gade Mouchchh Bankoo|| Mande Aan Bankoo||
translation: Holding their winsome whiskers, the proud warriors are somewhere engaged in fighting.

gurmukhi: ਢਕਾ ਢੁੱਕ ਢਾਲੰ ॥ ੳੁਠੇ ਹਾਲ ਚਾਲੰ ॥੪੮॥
translation: Somewhere the weapons are being struck with great knocking on the shield, a great commotion has arisen (in the field). 48
